message.raw:
* Added get_default_unit_conversion_classes (as per NovatechDDS9m) to use
  MOGLabsDDS amplitude and frequency conversion classes by default. This removes
  the requirement to specify unit conversion classes at every instantiation.
* Changed base_units of the DeviceTab from MHz to Hz. Amplitude base remains int
* Implemented smart programming (checks gate and duration of each instruction).
* During __init__ of Worker:
    - turn TRIGSYNC on
    - ensure table is only 2 instructions long.
    - turn SYNC off (this will be changed soon, but is broken currently).
    - enable automatic TABLE,RESTART. This is buggy before a table is programmed.
* Use unit conversion classes when:
    - Returning amplitude from check_remote_values (device returns non-native unit).
    - Parsing front panel values and table instructions (base_unit of freq is not native to device).
* Fixed bug where table_length was not cast to integer when checking smart_cache
* Specifying durations of instructins from TABLE_DATA['time'].
  TODO: Store the durations instead of absolute times in TABLE_DATA
* STOP/START table as final step(s) of transition_to_buffered to update table.
* Stored trigger_times as attribute to TABLE_DATA for future implementation of waits.
message.html:
• Added get_default_unit_conversion_classes (as per NovatechDDS9m) to use
    MOGLabsDDS amplitude and frequency conversion classes by default. This removes
    the requirement to specify unit conversion classes at every instantiation.
  • Changed base_units of the DeviceTab from MHz to Hz. Amplitude base remains int
  • Implemented smart programming (checks gate and duration of each instruction).
  • During init of Worker:
    • turn TRIGSYNC on
    • ensure table is only 2 instructions long.
    • turn SYNC off (this will be changed soon, but is broken currently).
    • enable automatic TABLE,RESTART. This is buggy before a table is programmed.
  • Use unit conversion classes when:
    • Returning amplitude from check_remote_values (device returns non-native unit).
    • Parsing front panel values and table instructions (base_unit of freq is not native to device).
  • Fixed bug where table_length was not cast to integer when checking smart_cache
  • Specifying durations of instructins from TABLE_DATA['time'].
    TODO: Store the durations instead of absolute times in TABLE_DATA
  • STOP/START table as final step(s) of transition_to_buffered to update table.
  • Stored trigger_times as attribute to TABLE_DATA for future implementation of waits.

message:
* Added get_default_unit_conversion_classes (as per NovatechDDS9m) to use
  MOGLabsDDS amplitude and frequency conversion classes by default. This removes
  the requirement to specify unit conversion classes at every instantiation.
* Changed base_units of the DeviceTab from MHz to Hz. Amplitude base remains int
* Implemented smart programming (checks gate and duration of each instruction).
* During __init__ of Worker:
    - turn TRIGSYNC on
    - ensure table is only 2 instructions long.
    - turn SYNC off (this will be changed soon, but is broken currently).
    - enable automatic TABLE,RESTART. This is buggy before a table is programmed.
* Use unit conversion classes when:
    - Returning amplitude from check_remote_values (device returns non-native unit).
    - Parsing front panel values and table instructions (base_unit of freq is not native to device).
* Fixed bug where table_length was not cast to integer when checking smart_cache
* Specifying durations of instructins from TABLE_DATA['time'].
  TODO: Store the durations instead of absolute times in TABLE_DATA
* STOP/START table as final step(s) of transition_to_buffered to update table.
* Stored trigger_times as attribute to TABLE_DATA for future implementation of waits.
